title: Erste Neue 2013 Lagrein (Alto Adige)
description: Subdued aromas of violet, bilberry and mountain herb guide the nose while the easygoing palate offers fleshy black cherry, clove and tangerine zest. Soft, round tannins make this perfect for everyday enjoyment so drink soon.

title: Finca Manzanos 2014 Blanco Viura-Chardonnay (Rioja)
description: Peach blossom and dusty melon aromas set up a snappy palate with a mix of salty, melony flavors along with hints of nut skins and papaya. On the finish, a yeasty flavor softens juicy, nervy acidity and related citrus notes.

title: Famille Negrel 2015 Nuit Blanche en Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Sourced from grapes outside the family's Mas de Cadenet estate, this wine is light, fresh and immediately attractive. Its clear, open texture is ripe but refreshing with a soft fruity aftertaste. The name means “sleepless night” because the grapes are harvested at night.

title: Domaine du Grand Cros 2015 Jules Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The entry-level wine at the Faulkner family's estate, this is easygoing, ripe and bright, with citrus plus cherry and strawberry flavors. With soft texture and lively acidity, it will be very drinkable on its own.

title: Domaine de la Croix 2015 Eloge Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Immediately attractive, this fresh wine has crisp fruit and lively acidity. It offers a straight shot of red fruits and lemon, with a tight, mineral texture. The wine will make a fine apéritif.

title: Cellier Saint-Sidoine 2015 Saint-Sidoine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: From a warm, south-facing vineyard, this is a sunny wine. Ripe red fruits are lifted by acidity. The background has a pepper and spice character that leaves the wine dry, almost structured. Drink now.

title: Château de Brigue 2015 Rosé 83 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The “83” refers to the department number of the Var, the winery's home county in Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur. This open, gentle wine dances with attractive bright, fresh fruitiness. It is crisply textured, with a strong citrus element along with raspberry sweetness. It is an apéritif style.

title: Artesa 2014 Block 92 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This youthful wine will benefit from further time in bottle, but its full-bodied concentration is heady for now, a punchy, temperamental mix of sweet peach, vanilla bean and medium acidity. Intense on the nose and palate, it displays a quite ripe personality.

title: Barton & Guestier 2015 La Villa Barton Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is an elegant and light wine. It is full of clean raspberries and red currants, lightly textured and with a bright finish that has refreshing acidity.

title: Bedell 2014 Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Earthy whiffs of struck flint and smoke require some aeration to blow off, but patience is rewarded with pristine grapefruit, lemon and lime notes. Light bodied and nervy in acidity, it's an elegant Chardonnay that finishes on a delightful saline tone.

title: Bedell 2014 Gewürztraminer (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Classic rose and lychee notes are dusted by hints of potpourri and bramble in this unusually spry Gewürztraminer. Bright tangerine sweetens the midpalate, leading to a fresh, blossomy finish.

title: Benziger 2013 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: Considerable aromas of eucalyptus, Bay leaf and cedar rise to the front of this wine, making for an inviting, savory introduction that provides a reasonable complexity. Easygoing, approachable and softly light bodied, it'll do well at the table and big-crowd events.

title: Ca' Momi 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros-Napa Valley)
description: A healthy portion of barrel influence is felt in this reserve wine, amid medium acidity. This makes for a robust, full-bodied experience, highlighted by caramel apple pie and pineapple, with muddles of butterscotch.

title: Château Roubine 2015 R de Roubine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The entry-level wine at Roubine, this offers so much attractive, lighthearted fruit. It is crisp, packed with tight acidity and red currant flavors. It has a light, bright, deliciously perfumed aftertaste.

title: Château Sainte Roseline 2015 Perle by Roseline Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Produced from grapes purchased from local growers, this is the entry-level wine of the Rosaline range. It is crisp, clean with an attractive ripeness from the red-berry fruits. It is in a refreshing apéritif style.

title: Domaines Pierre Chavin 2015 Pierre et Paul Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The traditional skittle bottle shape always looks attractive on a summer table. This soft wine with its red currant and strawberry flavors is just right as an apéritif, lively and bright with acidity to cut through the fruitiness. It is ready to drink.

title: Dumas Station 2012 Minnick Hills Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Reserved aromas of ripe red apple, cherry, dried herbs and spice are followed by quite ripe black fruit flavors speckled with vanilla and cocoa notes. It doesn't all come together perfectly but still provides interest.

title: Dumas Station 2013 Cow Catcher Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot make up three-quarters of this blend, with the balance Petit Verdot and Syrah. The aromas of herb, barrel spice, fig, dried fruit and vanilla are reserved while the red- and black-fruit flavors are rich but deft, with the tannins providing some heft. It seems a bit more evolved than its age might suggest.

title: Hersly 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Chocolate and caramel brace themselves against a crisper note of spearmint in this thick and near-syrupy wine, built with tremendous structure and weight, the finish somewhat puckering in coconut flakes.

title: Moncigale 2015 Frais et Fruité Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: A simple, fruity wine, this has light acidity and a touch of pepper at the end. It is a classic apéritif style of rosé.

title: Montecappone 2014 Mirizzi  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
description: This linear white opens with delicate aromas that recall citrus blossom, citrus peel and orchard fruit. The racy palate offers green Anjou pear, lime and a note of bitter almond alongside a backbone of firm acidity.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Keating 2013 Buchignani Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Bacon meat and blackberry pie jump from the glass in this full-bodied, ripely concentrated vineyard-designate, a strong and powerful wine. Smoky oak and a thickness of body weight round out the big, bold experience.

title: Naggiar 2011 Don Giovanni Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This medium-bodied wine has dried herb and black olive aromas, fresh raspberry and cherry flavors that are a bit tart and a tangy balance. It's not overly big in style, but is bright and well-suited to go with a wide variety of foods.

title: Girasole 2014 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: Savory and fruity flavors combine in this full-bodied, mouth-filling and affordable wine that was made from certified organic grapes. There are hints of smoke and meat along with ripe plum to complete the picture.

title: Grace Lane 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas of black currant, black cherry and plum announce this warm vintage wine. The flavors are plump and easy drinking, trailing slightly toward the finish.

title: Forstreiter 2015 Grooner Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Bursting with Conference pear flavor, this supple, fun and crisp all-rounder should be drunk as soon as possible to make most of the primary fruit.

title: Philo Ridge 2014 Ferrington Vineyard Gewurztraminer (Anderson Valley)
description: Overt floral and lychee aromas, lean peach and bosc pear flavors and a smooth, dry texture make an exotic mix for this medium-bodied wine.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2015 Edición Rosa Grenache (Navarra)
description: Fresh for the summer season is this tutti-frutti Navarran Garnacha. Pink in color and pumped up, this tastes of pink grapefruit, nectarine and citrus pith. It's all about freshness and drinkability.

title: Marotti Campi 2014 Luzano  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
description: This opens with aromas that recall acacia flower, chamomile and a whiff of beeswax. The zesty palate offers grapefruit, green apple and hint of white almond alongside racy acidity.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

title: Mascota 2015 ROD Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Clean, neutral aromas of white fruits, hay and vanilla wafer lead to a citrusy, round palate. This fresh Chardonnay offers orange and apple cider flavors in front of a clean finish.
